page.title: 05RAILWAY STATIONS
page.content: {Godstone and Crowhurst Junction {Railway Stations}lie on the Reading to Tonbridge Line. This line was opened for{South Eastern Railways}in May 1842. {Godstone Station}lies three miles south of Godstone and gave rise to the small village of South Godstone. The only building of significance to exist before the railway appeared was{Lagham {Manor. The importance of the railway has deteriorated in the last ten years as most local people now own cars. It is used by school children to and from school and by some adults. The total number of passengers seen on the Redhill train,one lunchtime,was five. At{Crowhurst Junction}a double line spur was opened in 1884 to connect trains with the London to Brighton Line.
